Posts.Content: I have join this group hoping to find some sort of reassurance? Don't know if that is really the right word. I took my mum who is 69, to the GP on Monday after she had found a lump in her Breast which had also given off some discharge. After examination he diagnosed cancer, and told her then he would refer her to a specialist for further tests. So we we are now left waiting for an appointment to see what we are dealing with. My main question in all this is can a Doctor diagnos the lump to be cancer just for examination? Be grateful to anyone who may be able to help with this , thanks.
Posts.Title: Can GP tell if a lump is cancer?

Posts.Content: Thanks Dorothee for that reply. I also thought the same, that it was quiet a call for the doctor to come straight out with it. I thought that further tests would be done before he would be so sure as to state that it was cancer. I will definitely be going with her though as I know how tough it's going to be for her. Thanks again, nice to know this service is avaliable from Macmillan. Talking definitely helps.
Posts.Title: Can GP tell if a lump is cancer?

Posts.Content: Thanks George and Jackie, Your advice has been great, knowing there is someone you can turn to is great.
Posts.Title: Can GP tell if a lump is cancer?

Posts.Content: Thank you Jacky's for your reply. I also thought it was quiet harsh for him To just come out with it without tests to back him up , so to speak. I also hope that the tests prove otherwise, but so glad I found this group to help whatever the tests turn out to be. Thanks again, all the best to you xx
Posts.Title: Can GP tell if a lump is cancer?

Posts.Content: Sorry to hear that Rebecca. Hope you are ok , all the best x
Posts.Title: Can GP tell if a lump is cancer?
